intro: Lachnaea penicillata, commonly known as the slender lichen, is a species of lichen that belongs to the family Lecanoraceae. It is a symbiotic organism composed of a fungal partner and a photosynthetic algal partner, typically a member of the genus Trebouxia. The thallus of L. penicillata is usually crustose, forming a thin, flat layer on rocks or soil surfaces. It is often found in moist, shaded environments, particularly in temperate regions. This lichen is known for its ability to tolerate environmental stress and is used as an indicator species in ecological studies.
